snippet: A reader analytics company in London wants to use data on our reading habits to transform how publishers acquire, edit and market books.
abstract: London-based reader analytics company Jellybooks gathers data about people's reading habits to help publishers rethink how to buy, edit and market e-books.

byline.original: By ALEXANDRA ALTER and KARL RUSSELL

lead_paragraph: A reader analytics company in London wants to use data on our reading habits to transform how publishers acquire, edit and market books.

headline.main: Moneyball for Book Publishers: A Detailed Look at How We Read
headline.print_headline: ­Moneyball for Book Publishers, Tracking the Way We Read
